intro: Schultesianthus venosus, commonly known as the veiny schultesianthus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with prominent veins and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
